intro: Biscutella varia subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its upright stems, small white or pale yellow flowers, and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or steppe environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
